hypothesis_content.title: Post-News Sentiment Fade for High-Beta Alts
hypothesis_content.statement: For high-beta approved alts (e.g., PEPE, DOGE, TRUMP), a >15% price spike within 2 hours on high volume (>3x 20-hour average) driven by identifiable news/social media hype, followed by a failure to hold the high, will result in a mean reversion capturing at least 50% of the spike's gains on a short position.
hypothesis_content.rationale: High-beta altcoins are prone to 'pump and dump' behavior on news. A sharp, high-volume spike that fails to hold indicates weak follow-through and likely selling by the initial buyers. This is a classic 'fade the news' mean reversion setup.
entry_conditions: Identifiable news or social catalyst (e.g., tweet, announcement)
Price fails to hold: makes a lower high within the next 4 hours after the peak

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces to a level that captures 50% of the initial 2-hour spike's gains (from entry short)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price exceeds the high of the initial 2-hour spike by 2%

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The 50% retracement TP is not achieved before the stop-loss or time exit in the majority (>50%) of qualifying events.
